title: feat: download file from remote server
body:
# What
Add the ability to download a file from the remote server via SFTP.

# Improvements
This is a naive implementation, for now it loads the complete file in memory before writing it to the disk.
We can handle larger file size by using buffers, it can be applied to the upload_file function too.

If the file download fails, the local file will not be deleted, i guess it's up to the user to take action accordingly.

I'm not sure if this unit test is enough, feel free to guide me.

title: chore: update to 2024 edition and deps
body:
This pull request introduces several updates across multiple files to enhance CI workflows, update dependencies, and improve code quality and testing. Key changes include adding new CI jobs for Rust checks, updating dependencies and Rust edition in `Cargo.toml`, and refactoring test code for better readability and functionality.

### CI Workflow Enhancements:
* [`.github/workflows/ci.yml`](diffhunk://#diff-b803fcb7f17ed9235f1e5cb1fcd2f5d3b2838429d4368ae4c57ce4436577f03fR4-R5): Added a new job for Rust checks, including `cargo fmt` and `cargo clippy`, and set `RUSTFLAGS` to enforce warnings as errors. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-b803fcb7f17ed9235f1e5cb1fcd2f5d3b2838429d4368ae4c57ce4436577f03fR4-R5) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-b803fcb7f17ed9235f1e5cb1fcd2f5d3b2838429d4368ae4c57ce4436577f03fR17-R25)
* [`.github/workflows/super_lint.yml`](diffhunk://#diff-7ceffefa2971a73c517d118c6f9ef56e6d8b53f1ea1f6cc53a1ff91ed7ae14b5L7-R7): Updated Super Linter to version `7.4.0` and disabled Rust validation temporarily until Rust `1.85`. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-7ceffefa2971a73c517d118c6f9ef56e6d8b53f1ea1f6cc53a1ff91ed7ae14b5L7-R7) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-7ceffefa2971a73c517d118c6f9ef56e6d8b53f1ea1f6cc53a1ff91ed7ae14b5L20-R27)

### Dependency and Environment Updates:
* [`Cargo.toml`](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542L4-R4): Updated Rust edition to `2024` and bumped versions of dependencies like `russh`, `russh-sftp`, `thiserror`, and `tokio`. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542L4-R4) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-2e9d962a08321605940b5a657135052fbcef87b5e360662bb527c96d9a615542L19-R22)
* [`tests/async-ssh2-tokio/Dockerfile`](diffhunk://#diff-45cccc8345eae9ddcae5cc9ed35d6dc3f8bcee12d04d44aeeb98440defe9ed95L1-R1): Updated the Rust base image to `1.85.0`.

### Code Quality Improvements:
* [`src/client.rs`](diffhunk://#diff-7f93c4e263c4e9ec748f804c7fd04a3b2fde86ffd741fb5516d67e1097bae4c1L670-R675): Refactored test code to replace `expect` with `unwrap_or_else` for better error handling and removed unnecessary references in function calls. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-7f93c4e263c4e9ec748f804c7fd04a3b2fde86ffd741fb5516d67e1097bae4c1L670-R675) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-7f93c4e263c4e9ec748f804c7fd04a3b2fde86ffd741fb5516d67e1097bae4c1L904-R903) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-7f93c4e263c4e9ec748f804c7fd04a3b2fde86ffd741fb5516d67e1097bae4c1L917-R916) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-7f93c4e263c4e9ec748f804c7fd04a3b2fde86ffd741fb5516d67e1097bae4c1L1103-R1102)

### Miscellaneous:
* [`tests/docker-compose.yml`](diffhunk://#diff-e63f0ca35966a726ffc6894c07d1fe38b1870304c71f615e9cd404789c357732L2): Minor formatting adjustments to the file.

title: Add support for direct-tcpip channels
body:
This PR exposes the `russh` support for opening `direct-tcpip` channels.

`direct-tcpip` channels are used to implement things like local port forwards.  (Equivalent to the `ssh` `-L` flag.)

title: Add support for keyboard-interactie auth.
body:
# What

This change adds support for the keyboard-interactive authentication method described in RFC 4256.

# Implementation

This solution introduces the `AuthKeyboardInteractive` builder, which can be converted into an `AuthMethod`.

```rust
let kbi = AuthKeyboardInteractive::new()
    .with_response("Password: ", "abt")
    .with_response("OTP: ", "12345");

let auth = AuthMethod::with_keyboard_interactive(kbi);
...
```

This implementation allows defining responses to known and exact prompts.

 
# Implementation Considerations

Although my solution addresses my problem, it might be too limited for others. Here are some considerations:
 - Should prompts be trimmed of white spaces before comparison?
 - Should prompt comparisons be case-insensitive?
 - Should we add an async handler so API users can implement custom responses (e.g., asking SMS services for OTPs)?
 
If the answer to any of these questions is yes, I am willing to implement those changes.

title: Add method to auth with public key file using ssh-agent
body:
# What

This PR:
- Adds the ability to auth by just providing a public key file path which uses ssh-agent to sign the request.

# Why

Some keys - eg. those created by [Secretive](https://github.com/maxgoedjen/secretive) - are stored in the Secure Enclave of MacOS and we cannot export the private key material. Instead, we should use ssh-agent to specify triggering a signing request against it.

title: release 0.8.0
body:
This release includes the following improvements

- Client now implements the clone trait; Client is now cloneable.
- Server validity checks using known_hosts now support domain name access.

These contributions were made by @cybersoulK (https://github.com/cybersoulK). Again, thanks are due to cybersoulK. Thank you very much.

test client::tests::server_check_by_known_hosts_for_hostname ... FAILED

title: implement Clone for Client
body:
Shouldn't client be Clonable? Since we can create multiple copies and run execute independently from each other? from what i can see, russh creates independent channels, and it seems safe to implement Arc over the Handle.

Since this library is high level, It's better to have it Clonable, rather than implementing Arc over all of the async_ssh2_tokio::Client. how do you think?

Update rust version in CI environment. Because dependency library (russh-keys) uses let-else statement, and this feature requires that rust version should be over 1.65.

title: Update dependency russh: 0.37.0-beta.1 -> 0.38.0
body: This solves the issue with russh 0.37.x depending on [insecure versions of ed25519-dalek](https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2022-0093).

title: Improve stderr handling of Client::execute
body:
As per the SSH specification, stdout is received by extended data messages the same way stdout is received by data messages.
Search for `SSH_EXTENDED_DATA_STDERR` in this document https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc4254
So we are receiving the stderr data over the wire but just not exposing it to the user.

To fix this I believe `CommandExecutedResult` should be extended to include a `stderr` field.
Unfortunately this is a breaking change, since structs can be matched on, so we'll have to release this as v0.7.0 
Since this is a breaking change we may as well rename `output` to `stdout` to make its purpose more clear alongside the `stderr` field.

title: More error message fixes
body: Includes the inner error in the error message for error variants that have an inner error.

title: Increase number of sequential execution in test
body:
The following PR should make the sequential commands test more stable in a CI environment, so I increased the number of executions to check the effect. Previously, we observed very rare failures in the CI environment.

PR: https://github.com/Miyoshi-Ryota/async-ssh2-tokio/pull/29

title: chore: cleanup some comment and apply fmt
Improve message handling in Client::execute to deal with apparent incompatibility with Ubuntu 18.04.6/openssh7.6p1
body:
When using async-ssh2-tokio to talk to Ubuntu 18.04.6 / openssh7.6p1 server, I observe that sometimes the command executes but I get no returned output data. On debugging this, I noted that this seems to due to the ordering of the messages received from the server. Sometimes, for reasons I do not understand, the server delivers the ExitStatus message to the client BEFORE it has delivered the Data (or Extended Data) message. This causes client::execute to wrap up the text it has so far, copy the return code, and return to the caller.

Waiting for Eof message is not a good strategy either because sometimes the Exit-Status messages seems to come after that.

This PR changes that logic so that Data messages update the output string buffer, and Exit Status messages set the exit-status, but that until the channel returns None, because the server closes the channel, we continue to interpret messages.

title: Allow tests to compile without env vars set
body:
When the env vars needed for tests are not set, the tests completely fail to compile.
This is a problem because some contributors may not want to setup these env vars but the 50 compilation errors due to the tests failing makes development very difficult.

This approach also gives a nice test failure listing all the env vars, without needing to search through the 50 compilation errors for unique env vars.

title: Expose russh_keys errors to user
body:
Previously using an RSA key gave me the error `KeyInvalid`, not very informative.
With this change it now gives me the error `KeyInvalid(UnsupportedKeyType([114, 115, 97]))`.
Which is a bit better.
I filed a PR upstream to improve that further: https://github.com/warp-tech/russh/pull/161
But no reason for that to block this PR.

title: Remove unnecessary mut borrow of Client
body:
The `Client::execute` (and `Client::disconnect`, although that's probably not as important) method takes `self` as a mutable reference, which prevents running two commands simultaneously. If you try (using the `futures::try_join` macro, for instance):
```rust
async fn test(
    client: &mut async_ssh2_tokio::client::Client,
) -> Result<(), async_ssh2_tokio::Error> {
    futures::try_join!(
        client.execute("time_consuming_command"),
        client.execute("time_consuming_command"),
    )?;

    Ok(())
}
```
the borrow checker understandably complains:
```
error[E0499]: cannot borrow `*client` as mutable more than once at a time
```
However, neither of the two methods actually needs the mut borrow (the relevant russh methods are `channel_open_session` and `disconnect`, and they both take the connection handle as `&self`), and when I just removed it, the example compiled and seemed to work as expected ^^

title: style: give names to config options
body:
Previously, one of the `AuthMethod` arms is

```rust
PrivateKey(String, Option<String>), // entire contents of private key file
```

which does not tell user what should the `String` and `Option<String>` be.

Now it is changed to be

```rust
PrivateKey {
    /// entire contents of private key file
    key_data: String,
    key_pass: Option<String>,
},
```

which not only tells the purpose of each field, but also fixes the comment type so that the comment becomes the docs of `key_data`.

title: Server checking using known_hosts file
body: Added an option to use a default or custom `known_hosts` file for server key checking.

title: Key Auth and Server Checking
body:
Added options for key authentication from file or string with optional passphrase.
Added options for checking sever key from file or string.
Added scripts for testing with local sshd or local debugging sshd.
Upgraded ssh test docker due to lingering concurrent test issues with older sshd.
Added tests for new features and added keys to test dockers.
Upgraded russh version for required fix for keys with passphrase.

title: Russh upgrade, connect revert
body:
Upgraded to russh version that properly closes channels, permitting unlimited sequential executes over a single connection. The aforementioned limit on open channels still applies and restricts the number of simultaneous executes.

Went back to using `connect` as the constructor. This was a breaking change so I bumped the minor version.

I have another PR almost ready to go for key authentication and server checking that will have more breaking changes to the constructor (connect) method. If you prefer to combine the two together so there is only one version bump, let me know.

title: Version 0.4.0 rework
body:
I have improved the ergonomics and documentation of this crate. This is obviously a breaking change and I have thus bumped the version to 0.4.0. After your review of #12 I've changed some more stuff.

I'm open to discussion to any change I've made, discussion can only lead to better code.

* The client now takes `ToSocketAddrs` as a address
* Preferred the use of `&str` arguments over String for ergonomics
* The client can now execute multiple commands. See #12 
* The client now connects in the constructor. See https://github.com/Miyoshi-Ryota/async-ssh2-tokio/issues/12 for the disucssion
* Every public types should now have documentation
* Some more tests where added, the docs test are now compile only
* Tests can now also be run locally without docker by setting environment variables
* The Error type was renamed to fit the ecosystem style
* Reexport the common types in the top level module
* The readme was updated with links to the docs
* This is a breaking change from 0.3.0 and previous 0.4.0 commits
